channel.title: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jon Stewart Will Leave 'The Daily Show' This Year
item.description: Stewart let the news slip during a taping of his show today. Comedy Central said Stewart will remain at the helm of the influential satire show until "later this year."
item.content:encoded:
Stewart let the news slip during a taping of his show today. Comedy Central said Stewart will remain at the helm of the influential satire show until "later this year."

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Proposed Law In Puerto Rico Would Fine Parents Of Obese Children
item.description: Education officials would identify the children and parents would have six months to get them to lose weight. If they don't, after another six-month period, parents could face a hefty fine.
item.content:encoded:
Education officials would identify the children and parents would have six months to get them to lose weight. If they don't, after another six-month period, parents could face a hefty fine.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Chelsea Manning To Be 'Guardian' Columnist
item.description: The former Army intelligence analyst, who was sentenced to 35 years in prison for leaking classified information, will write for the newspaper's U.S. website. She won't be paid.
item.content:encoded:
The former Army intelligence analyst, who was sentenced to 35 years in prison for leaking classified information, will write for the newspaper's U.S. website. She won't be paid.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: After Ruling, Alabama Faces Hodgepodge Of Same-Sex Marriage Policies
item.description: Gay rights advocates have asked a federal court to order probate judges in Alabama to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.
item.content:encoded:
Gay rights advocates have asked a federal court to order probate judges in Alabama to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Newly Discovered Footage Shows Sinking Of SS Eastland
item.description: Robert Siegel speaks with grad student Jeff Nichols about his recent find of footage from the 1915 SS Eastland disaster in Chicago.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel speaks with grad student Jeff Nichols about his recent find of footage from the 1915 SS Eastland disaster in Chicago.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Guess How Much Of Uncle Sam's Money Goes To Foreign Aid? Guess Again!
item.description: A poll shows that Americans have no clue about the percent of the budget pie that is directed to foreign aid. But maybe it's not our fault.
item.content:encoded:
A poll shows that Americans have no clue about the percent of the budget pie that is directed to foreign aid. But maybe it's not our fault.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Poncie Rutsch

item.title: California's Strawberry Feud Ends, But Who Will Breed New Berries?
item.description: Strawberry farmers have dropped a lawsuit against the University of California, Davis, and the university has hired a new strawberry breeder. But the future of academic berry breeding is uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
Strawberry farmers have dropped a lawsuit against the University of California, Davis, and the university has hired a new strawberry breeder. But the future of academic berry breeding is uncertain.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Dan Charles

item.title: When It's Hard To Get A Vaccine Exemption, More Kids Get Shots
item.description: Robert Siegel speaks to Emory University epidemiologist Dr. Saad Omer about his research into state laws covering non-medical vaccine exemptions.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel speaks to Emory University epidemiologist Dr. Saad Omer about his research into state laws covering non-medical vaccine exemptions.

» E-Mail This

item.title: With New Moves, Russia's Parliament Looks To Rewrite History
item.description: Russia's seizure of Crimea has been widely criticized. But what if Crimea was given away illegally to Ukraine back in 1954? Russian lawmakers are hard at work on their own version of history.
item.content:encoded:
Russia's seizure of Crimea has been widely criticized. But what if Crimea was given away illegally to Ukraine back in 1954? Russian lawmakers are hard at work on their own version of history.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Corey Flintoff

item.title: Texas Insurance Brokers Play Bigger Obamacare Role
item.description: Despite an uneasy relationship to the health law, insurance brokers are touting their expertise and helping Texans sign up for Affordable Care Act insurance.
item.content:encoded:
Despite an uneasy relationship to the health law, insurance brokers are touting their expertise and helping Texans sign up for Affordable Care Act insurance.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Carrie Feibel

item.title: Failing Bridges Taking A Toll; Some States Move To Raise Gas Tax
item.description: With gas prices down, a growing number of states are turning to a gas tax increase. New Jersey looks at following suit to fund much-needed projects, but some drivers aren't eager to pay up.
item.content:encoded:
With gas prices down, a growing number of states are turning to a gas tax increase. New Jersey looks at following suit to fund much-needed projects, but some drivers aren't eager to pay up.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Family Confirms Death Of American Hostage Held By ISIS Militants
item.description: The family of Kayla Mueller released a statement on Tuesday confirming her death while being held hostage by ISIS militants. Mueller's death raises questions about whether U.S. policies made it more difficult to save her.
item.content:encoded:
The family of Kayla Mueller released a statement on Tuesday confirming her death while being held hostage by ISIS militants. Mueller's death raises questions about whether U.S. policies made it more difficult to save her.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Tech May Get In The Way Of Good Culture Shock While Studying Abroad
item.description: A record number of Americans are studying abroad. Educators say that's good, as it promotes better cross-cultural understanding. But many in the field worry the influx of technology and social media may be hampering students' ability to fully immerse themselves abroad.
item.content:encoded:
A record number of Americans are studying abroad. Educators say that's good, as it promotes better cross-cultural understanding. But many in the field worry the influx of technology and social media may be hampering students' ability to fully immerse themselves abroad.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Nina Keck

item.title: New Government Agency Designed To Tackle Cyber Threats More Effectively
item.description: The Obama administration is creating a new agency to gather and distribute intelligence on cyber threats more quickly. The agency is modeled after the National Counter Terrorism Center, created after Sept. 11 to improve information sharing across the U.S. government.
item.content:encoded:
The Obama administration is creating a new agency to gather and distribute intelligence on cyber threats more quickly. The agency is modeled after the National Counter Terrorism Center, created after Sept. 11 to improve information sharing across the U.S. government.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tom Gjelten

item.title: New Illinois Governor Has Unions Bristling Less Than A Month Into The Job
item.description: Illinois' new Republican governor is taking a page in politics from other Midwestern states. Bruce Rauner is setting policies that have government labor unions bristling and he hasn't even been on the job for a month.
item.content:encoded:
Illinois' new Republican governor is taking a page in politics from other Midwestern states. Bruce Rauner is setting policies that have government labor unions bristling and he hasn't even been on the job for a month.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tony Arnold
